intro: Oreoherzogia guicciardii, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant has a rosette growth habit, with hairy, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. Its yellow flowers bloom in spring, and the plant produces achenes with pappus for wind dispersal. Oreoherzogia guicciardii is adapted to harsh desert conditions, showcasing features that enhance its survival in low-nutrient soils.
